docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: A Congressional subcommittee charged today that politically motivated officials at the Office of Management and Budget improperly pressured health experts into adopting a regulation easing food labeling requirements and ''undercut the credibility'' of the Food and Drug Administration.

headline.main: Politics Tipped Food Law, Panel Says

byline.original: By SUSAN F. RASKY, Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: A physician confessed that at first he hated his colicky newborn daughter, whose ''continuous high-pitched shriek'' made him want to shake her until she stopped. ''God, I thought, how can such a small helpless infant, my own beloved flesh, evoke such nearly uncontrollable hostility in me, her daddy, a physician?

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Clinical trials of experimental treatments in this country have long been shrouded in secrecy, their locations and often their very existence hidden from scientists and frustrated patients, some of whom are desperately seeking a life-saving cure.
